comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: delegates to the Hygiene Congress. (Do we still have these?) Item from NYTimes: Sept 18, 1912: "Foreign Doctors Invade Plaza Hotel", 200 Delegates to Intl Congress of Hygiene Keep Room Clerks Guessing. The article mentions Geheimrath Dr. W. His professor in the University of Berlin, who headed the party that arrived on the Cincinnati. One of the members of the party is Dr. Rudolph Lennhoff. Obit in NYTimes (dated Dec 27, 1933) Prof. Rudolf Lennhoff, one of the best known medical authorities in Berlin, died last night of apoplexy at the age of 68. He was the publisher of a library for social hygiene and of medical statistics and was recognized as an authority in the fields of heart, stomach and kidney.

comment._content: Which means he was only 47 in this photo!

comment._content: This Dr Wilhelm His is Wilhelm His Jr. His father, Wilhelm His Sr. (1831-1904), was the "Vesalius of human embryology "(O'Rahiily)
